help.desc: Select the alpha parameter of the Direchlet distribution (Berninger et al, 2008(Methods, 44(1):13-21). Default alpha value is 0.5
Filter the sequences according to a length cut-off
Filter the sequences according to a frequency cut-off
Select all isomiRs with a frequency contribution more than this value to the total of counts of variants annotated in the same miRNA.
Statistical method to exclude sequencing errors as the possible cause of the nucleotide modifications. (Dohm et al., 2008, Nu Ac Res., 36 (16): e105)
Select teh start position of the miRNA region in the case of nt-substitution analysis
Select teh end position of the miRNA region in the case of nt-substitution analysis
Select window size in the trimming and addition analysis. Default is 6, meaning of 3 position upstream of the dicing site, and 3 position downstream of the dicing site will be considered
Check this box to distinguish the reference miRNAs from the rest of miRNA variants, in the cluster analysis
Check this box to distinguish the nt-substitution variants from the rest of IsomiRs and reference miRNAs, in the cluster analysis
Check this box to distinguish the 5’-trimming variants from the rest of IsomiRs and reference miRNAs, in the cluster analysis
Check this box to distinguish the 3’-trimming variants from the rest of IsomiRs and reference miRNAs, in the cluster analysis
Check this box to distinguish the 3’-addition variants from the rest of IsomiRs and reference miRNAs, in the cluster analysis
Scale the frequency of every sequence according to the following eqaution: Scale freq n= (freq n/(sum freqs all seqs)*X. The default value of X is 1.000.000
Remove all counts above the value determined by this quantile
Remove all counts below the value determined by this quantile
Select the type of logarithmic transformation of the sequences frequency (log2, log10, ln) or the absolute frequency values

Select the type of statistical parameter if the frequency should be centered resptect to the mean, median, mode, min or quantile parametes of the distribution, or select (…) if no statistical parameter is chosen.
Select all sequences mapped onto a specific database. If the textbox is empty all databases used for annotation will be considered in the analysis
Select if every different sequence is aconsidered as one point, or all sequences mapped onto the same locus is considered as one point.
